title: Writing
text:
This writing hub separates personal, biblical studies, and creative writing into distinct pages while keeping search unified across the whole website.


Personal
Reflections, lessons learned, and progress updates.


Biblical Studies
Study notes, interpretation work, and long-form scripture-focused writing.


Writing / Creative Writing
Drafts, short creative pieces, and writing process notes.


Use the search box in the top navigation to find content across every section.

title: Sample Study Note: Reading with Context
text:
This sample post models how I plan to publish biblical studies notes with clear structure and references.
Future posts will include passage observations, context notes, and practical application points.

title: Demos

Parcel Map Demo

title: Welcome
text: This site is my one-stop home for writing, data visualization work, biblical studies notes, and interactive demos.

title: Project Title Template
text:
Data
List sources, file formats, important fields, and known quality limitations.

title: Project Title Template
text:
Approach
Explain cleaning, transformation, modeling, and analysis steps.

title: Project Title Template
text:
Visuals
Embed or link key charts/maps/dashboards and explain how to interpret them.

title: Project Title Template
text:
Results
Summarize findings, outcomes, and recommendations.

title: Project Title Template
text:
Repro Steps (How Data Was Generated)

Place input data in assets/data/ or a project-specific data folder.
Run SQL/scripts to clean and shape the data.
Export analysis-ready outputs used by visuals.
Render/report and verify numbers against source totals.

title: Starting a One-Stop Personal Site
text:
Today I launched the first version of this site with a simple goal: keep writing consistent and organized.
This section is for short personal updates, lessons learned, and progress notes.

title: Sample Creative Piece
text:
A draft can be useful even when it is imperfect. This section is where I will publish writing experiments and polished pieces.
Expect short fiction, narrative fragments, and reflections on craft.
